It wasn't the house of a woman, it was a bachelor pad, something befitting a man in his late twenties. There was much less furniture and the place was definitely messier. There wasn't any of those homey touches you usually find in homes in which women lived. The living room was dominated by a large couch in front of a big screen TV. There was a coffee table littered with all sorts of junk, including plates with old food. The walls were still painted white, but it wasn't a soft white as before. It was more spartan.

Evan phoned Christine's cell phone, but she wasn't answering. He couldn't leave a message on the voice mail. (Evan didn't know that Christine was now grounded. She skipped school because she said she was sick and then she was found with a man a decade older than her. Her phone privileges were cut.)

With little else to do he explored his new house. Every room wasn't as he had left it, it was a bachelor pad (or as people call it now a man cave.) He did find his spare keys and some money and other spare forms of documentation. It said his name was Evan Wallace, he was 28 years old and this was his address. He also found that he had a job, he was no longer a student. The only thing that was feminine was his clothing. He found he had an extensive feminine wardrobe that was spread out throughout most of the closets and drawers in the house.

Evan had to find a way to switch back by tomorrow. If he didn't Christine would have to go to school and he would have to go to work. He was now a middle manager at an advertising agency. Several employees were under his leadership at the firm. Evan didn't know if this had been Christine's job before or it was what he would have been by the time he became 28.

What happens next?
1522321231212.title: Even returns to Christine's house.  Waits f...

15223212312121.content:
Miranda (Evan's former mother) dragged Christine home. Christine mostly walked on her own once Miranda put her in the right direction. Christine tried to explain, but Miranda wasn't hearing any of it. "Wait to we get home and then we'll talk," Miranda said.

Once they entered Evan's house, Christine couldn't get a word in edgewise.

"Christine, I let you stay home because you said you were sick," Miranda shouted. "Then I find you out with a man over ten years older than you. YOU ARE GROUNDED!"

"I'm grounded?" This hadn't happened to Christine since she might have been thirteen or so. Christine knew how to manipulate her real parents, but Miranda was made of sterner stuff.

"Yes, right now, go to your room and stay there. But first give me your phone. You can't use the phone or computer until further notice. Tomorrow you will go to school and then straight home You will not have any contact with that Evan guy again. He is way too old for you."

"But he was just being nice. There was nothing to it." Which Christine didn't know was a lie or not now that their ages had been swapped. Christine just knew that she had to get in touch with Evan to put everything right. It hadn't dawned on her yet that Miranda said that she was going to school tomorrow.

"No buts, just go to your room and remember no computer."

Christine went to her room. She instinctively knew where it was although she had never been to Evan's room before. When she got there, she was stunned at how girlie the room was. The walls were painted a light shade of yellow. The platform bed with four drawers for clothing. It was covered with a yellow comforter with white hearts and tear drops. There was three pillows at the headboard, one with a yellow pillow case, one with a white pillow case and a throw pillow on top which was adorned with a pink heart that said 'Planet' on it. Flanking the bed was a white dresser drawer and a white night stand. A lamp with a red shade was on the night stand. On the far wall was another dresser drawer although this one was shorter and wider. Upon it was a large mirror on this set of drawers and a jewelry case to the mirror's left. The window scarf t wasn't even a curtain, was white with red highlights on the bottom and sides. On the walls were pictures of clowns and posters of boy bands. There was a hardwood floor with one red rug that matched the lamp and 'window scarf' at the foot of the bed. It was definitely a room for a girl. The room she had as a girl was never like this, not that she didn't like this room. She did like the white and red motif. But her mother was different too and she hadn't been a teen for a decade.

For a second, Christine wondered if Evan was gay. But she knew he wasn't they had had sex just an hour ago. Then it hit her, this wasn't what Evan's room usually looked like. It was her room and so it was a room for a girl. She looked in the closets, but found only boy's clothing. This made sense too, since she had swapped clothing with Evan when this all began. The clothing was the only thing in the room that was designed for a boy.

She laid upon the bed, but realized that her window faces away from her house. She didn't have her phone and when she logged into the computer she found that it was disabled by Miranda. She had no way of contacting Evan. How could she switch back without talking to him.

She went into the bathroom to get some aspirin. The tension was giving her a headache. She found it as girlie as her bedroom. It even had all her makeup conveniently located. She had less items than she was used to, but the color combinations of her makeup were right. What was missing where the sexier colors that she used when she wanted to meet or influence men.

She wondered if she was a virgin now. In her regular life she wasn't a virgin at seventeen, but that too might have changed. It might be harder to get dates when you dress like a boy. Or it might be that Miranda was more strict than her real mother. Or a combination of the two.

She didn't have a plan, but she knew that she had to meet up with Evan at the first opportunity. She had been a makeup artist in her old life. She usually started work at 11 and worked to 7 or 8. Maybe she could stop at the shop where she worked and see him there after school. Miranda said to come straight home, but if the swap was reversed things would be alright. Christine had no way of knowing that Evan had a different profession since he went to college after high school and Christine didn't There would be no way of knowing, but maybe if Christine had also swapped her makeup, then Evan too would have become a makeup artist. But as a man, even though he wore dresses he had no plans on that profession.

What happens next?
15223212312121.title: Christine at home

choices: Evan decides he likes being an adult
Evan tries to think of a way to see Christine
152232123121211.content:
There was no way to contact Evan so Christine hung out in her room. There was a TV which she could use or she could use the time to polish her nails, listen to music or read a book. The books on her shelf were teen novels but they really weren't too different that the romance novels she had been reading. OK, there wouldn't be any 'sex' but the themes were the same. The TV was the same except the Wilson family didn't subscribe to any of the premium channels. The nail polish was bought from the dollar store. Christine supposed she would have to rough it until she returned to normal.

In the morning she got out of her pajamas and selected the clothes she would need for school. It took her no time to select. She picked jeans with a t-shirt and some athletic socks. She took her clothes to the bathroom and took a shower. She found all of her usual creams and lotions in the bathroom. Maybe not the brands she preferred but in the cheaper more generic version. After the shower she wrapped her hair in a towel and then got dressed. Then she took her time to blow dry her hair and put on makeup. She was glad that she hadn't swapped her makeup skills. If she couldn't wear pretty clothes at least doing her hair and putting on her makeup made her feel like a woman.

Her books were in a pink backpack from Aeropostale. Her and Miranda didn't talk during breakfast except for Miranda telling her to come straight home after school.

Christine knew where all her classes were. She assumed they were the same classes that Evan had been taking but they weren't. They were similar as all seniors take, but Christine had different strengths and interests so her classes were rearranged somewhat. Christine knew most everyone in her grade, but her friends were obviously different. She even had a somewhat boyfriend. Thinking back on her relationship with the boy she realized that she was a virgin. They had kissed and there was some heavy petting, but it hadn't gotten much farther than that. Miranda needed to know where she was at all times and phoned to check up on her. Her real parents had been much more lax.

The school day passed quickly. The work was appropriate for her skills and she fit in with her classmates. But she was an adult and she wanted to get back to her old life. Instead of coming straight home she went to the salon where she used to work. She expected that if she was at school, Evan would be doing her old job. But when she asked for him, she found that Evan not only wasn't there, Evan had never worked there.

She left the salon shaken. he didn't know how to contact Evan. She was going to stay this way for a while.

What happens next?
152232123121211.title: Follow Christine at school

1522321231212112.content:
While Christine was getting ready for school, Evan was waking up and getting ready for work. He got out of bed wearing a silky nightgown and some cotton bikini panties. Before taking a shower he had to select what he wanted to wear for the day. He had to choose his skirt suit first to determine what lingerie to wear. There were many to choose from. Some were eliminated because of the time of year. Others eliminated for other reasons. His fashion sense narrowed the list and then he made his final decision. It took over fifteen minutes to choose the suit and blouse which went with it. He chose a single button herringbone jacket with two decorative pockets, an above the knee button front pencil skirt and a white blouse. The blouse was a bit translucent so he needed a chemise. He wore nude support pantyhose to complete the professional look. To feel a little sexy in his business attire he decided upon lace panties and a matching bra. Whereas it used to take less than two minutes to selection the clothes for the day, now it always took close to twenty minute. He could cut down that time in the morning by selecting the night before. But his mood did influence what he wore and he only knew that in the morning.

Once he knew what he was going to wear, he took his shower. As always, it took less than seven minutes. He got into the shower, and simply washed his body with soap and his hair with shampoo. There wasn't any consideration of other products like Christine uses. Getting out he wrapped himself with a towel from the chest down. Then he combed his hair and took a shave in front of the mirror. At 28 he had to shave everyday now. He got dressed in his selected clothes. He wore sneakers for the trip to work. He packed up his wallet, keys and a pair of black pumps he would wear while at work in a brief case and left. His suit didn't have any pockets and he didn't carry a purse so the briefcase was the only place for keys and wallet.

Evan picked up the paper as he left his house. He had to take the bus to work since parking was so expensive in the city. Once he got there he bought a donut and coffee for breakfast and then entered the building where he worked. He knew his staff and coworkers as well as the intricacies of his job as if he graduated college and had several years of experience. He was a professional in every way when it came to his job and his relationship with his coworkers..

Evan left work close to 6:00 and then took the bus home. He finally got home a little after seven. He could do the work but it was hard. There wasn't any fooling around like in school. He longed for those days where his biggest concern was just a test that he could ace anyway. He didn't want to work full time leaving at 6:30 AM and returning at 7:15 PM. He wanted to return to his old life. Plenty of time for work when he really was 28.

Later that evening, the paperboy rang his doorbell. He put on his robe over his satin pajamas and answered the door. The paperboy went to his school although he was just fourteen years old and a freshman. Then it dawned on him, he could use his power to swap professions with the paperboy. Then he would not only be delivering papers, but would also be going to school instead of his job. At school he could swap with Christine and get his life back. If he was at the same school as Christine then at least he could find her without Miranda's interference.

What happens next?
1522321231212112.title: Evan tries to think of a way to see Christine

choices: Evan's new paper route and back to school
Matt changes his mind and runs after you
15223212312121121.content:
"I'm collecting for the paper," Matt said. Matt had been a paper boy for over a year now. Evan hadn't had much contact with him since he was three years younger than Evan. But he thought that he could be the key to solving his problem.

Evan needed to see Christine to make the swap and he couldn't contact her. She might have been Evan's next door neighbor, but Miranda was keeping them apart and there was nothing they could do about it. But if he was going to school with her he could find a way to meet without Miranda getting in the way.

"How much is it?"

"Six forty."

"OK, I'll get it. Do you like delivering papers?" Evan said trying to make some small talk.

"It's OK. I don't like getting up so early though."

"I see, how about school?"

"School's fine too."

"Just fine?"

"Who really wants to go to school?"

"I see, how would you like to go to work like a real adult instead of school"

"I don't think so."

"You could have my job. I'm an executive. I oversee the people who do the real work."

"Oh"

"If you could, would you agree to trade jobs, I'd deliver the papers and go to school and you do my job."

"That's silly."

"But if it could happen would you agree."

"I don't know."

"I'll tell you what, you get to keep the money you earn and if you don't like it we could swap back."

"How much money???"

"I make a lot more than a paper boy, Maybe fifty times more and I promise you can keep it all. Plus you won't have to go to school."

"What if I screw it up?"

"Don't worry. You will know everything you need to know."

"It's impossible."

"But if it was possible would you swap with me?"

"OK, I guess." That was all Evan needed to hear. Suddenly, Evan and Matt were no longer at Christine's house. He was outside Matt's house. He was the paperboy asking for money. The clothes he was wearing had changed too. He were dressed in his street clothes (skinny jeans and a pale top). He weren't sure where Matt was, Evan was at the front door collecting from Matt's mother. She handed him the money ($8 which included the tip) and he left. He had to finish Matt's rounds. He got on his bike and petaled to the next customer.

What happens next?

152232123121211211.content:
After collecting for the paper route, Evan finally arrived home. He found the silky pajamas and robe that he had on when Matt arrived at his door neatly hung up in his closet. He also found a book bag with his school books and the knowledge that he had to finish his homework before going to bed. Everything he knew about his job and what he had learned in college was gone, along with several years of high school experience. He was a freshman now. He did his homework and went to sleep.

In the morning he woke up and quickly got dressed. He put on yoga pants and a sports bra. Over the bra he put on a white t-shirt with pink sleeves. On his feet he wore anklet socks and canvas shoes. he was up earlier today than yesterday since he had to finish his paper route before his clients woke up and needed the paper.

The first step in the paper route was to fold the papers for throwing. Then he put them in a bag which he slung over his shoulder and rode his bike to deliver the papers. It was easier to do it by bike than by car since you didn't have to stop the car, get out and then throw the papers, you could throw them without having to slow down much. Evan knew where all his customers lived and the best path to get everyone their paper.

After he was done, then he returned home and picked out an outfit for school. He thought that this might be his last day wearing women's clothes so he decided to pick out something nice. He decided after looking through his wardrobe (all his skirt suits were gone) on a pleated skirt with a top with cold shoulders. he wore it with a thong and a pretty purple bra whose straps could be see under the cold shoulders. He finished his outfit with matching ballet flats. Once his outfit was chosen then he took his shower.

He didn't wait for Christine at the bus stop, he didn't know when she usually left for school. He knew his old schedule and would find her there. He waited as long as he could in front of his first period class, but she wasn't there. He didn't know her schedule was different that his old one. Finally he had to give up and go to his own first period class.

What happens next?

1522321231212112111.content:
After his first period class, Evan began to search for Christine again. He tried checking what would have been his second period class before all the swapping, but she wasn't there. Realizing that the swaps must have somehow resulted in Christine having a different schedule than his old one, Evan began to panic. How was he ever going to locate Christine to swap back now?

Throughout the rest of the day, Evan kept hoping he would somehow run into Christine so he could get back to normal, but that never happened. He never saw her in the hallways. He tried going to where his old locker would have been between classes, but Christine wasn't there either. He didn't know if she even had that locker. He scoured the cafeteria at lunch time, but quickly determined that Christine had a different lunch period than he did.

"What am I going to do?" Evan kept asking himself in desperation. "I don't want to be stuck like this forever."

15223212312121121111.content:
The second day was pretty much as the first. Evan woke up early and before taking a shower put on some active wear including a sports bra and delivered the papers from his bike. Then he returned home and took his shower. He put on a nice outfit, something pretty but appropriate for school. Underneath he wore something sexy. No one could see it, but he knew it made him feel sexy and that was good enough.

At school, Evan looked for Christine again between his first three periods, but she wasn't anywhere to be found. Evan couldn't possibly know that her schedule even though it was a schedule for a senior wasn't the same as his. It was a big school and without knowing where to look it would take a lot of time and random chance to bump into her.

Evan was getting frustrated, he needed a better plan. In his forth period class was a girl named Sherrie. Sherrie was about a year younger than Alex, but she was still one of her best friends. Evan didn't know much about her, but he had seen her around the house often. Sherrie was a sweet girl, but she was a fashion mess. Even before Evan had gained all of Christine's fashion sense he knew that she didn't know how to dress. The clothes she wore were mismatched and cheap. She still wore some clothes than an eight year old would wear along with clothes that a teenager would wear. It was an odd sight.

Evan hatched a plan, if he couldn't find Christine at school, he would have to see her at the house. But he knew that Miranda (his former mother) wouldn't let him anywhere near, not the way things were. But if he was Alex's friend, one of her best friends, then he could visit Alex and see Christine. It would work all he had to do was become friends with Alex.

"Hi Sherrie," Evan said trying to start a conversion.

"Hi," Sherrie said pausing because she didn't remember his name, then a second later it came to her, "Evan." Evan and Sherrie had little contact when he was Alex's brother. Now that he was unrelated to the Wilson family, there was little reason for Sherrie and Evan to know each other. They simply just had one class together. He was much older than she she was, almost twice her age.

"I have a secret I want to tell you," Evan said confidentially.

"Tell me?" Sherrie asked. Why would this man want to tell her anything.

"Yes, I can swap traits with people."

"You can do what?"

"I can swap traits with people. Like I could swap my hair with yours or anything else."

"Yeah right."

"It's true. Why do you think I'm still a freshman, when I'm 28 years old."

"I don't know, I suppose you were left back." It seemed perfectly reasonable for Evan to be in her grade. Just like it was also reasonable that he was clearly a man and was wearing a pretty outfit made for a woman.

"No, it's because I swapped with someone and now I'm a student in high school."

"I don't believe you."

"It's true."

"So what do you want with me."

"I want you to swap your relationship with Alex with me, so I'm her best friend."

"You want me to do what?!?"

Repeating Evan said, "I want you to swap your relationship with Alex with me, so I'm her best friend."

"Why do you want to do that?"

"It's complicated."

"You're not going to hurt Alex are you?"

"No of course not. I would never hurt Alex. She is like a sister to me. This doesn't really have anything to do with Alex. I just have to talk to her sister."

"Let me get this right, you want to become best friends with Alex just so you can talk to her sister."

"Yeah, I guess that is right."

"YOU ARE NUTS!!! But OK, What do I get out of it? All I'll do is lose a friend," Sherrie said althougb she didn't believe a word of what Evan told her.

"Ummm, what do you want?"

"Well you said you can swap traits. How about your entire wardrobe and how to use it?"

Evan hadn't thought that Sherrie would want anything in return. He was just winging it. "You want my wardrobe and all my fashion knowledge?"

"Yes. If you want to be Alex's friend that is what I want." Sherrie was striking a hard bargain but she didn't believe it would happen.

The clothes he was wearing wasn't his anyway so he agreed. But to be safe, "OK but when this is over we swap back. Is that fine with you?"

"Sure."

Evan concentrated and soon he was wearing a t-shirt with Winnie the Poo on it with stretchy knit black pants and white socks and canvas sneakers. Underneath he knew he was wearing plain white panties and a plain white bra. Sherrie looked much better wearing the trendy clothing. Evan could recognize the style in Sherrie's outfit, but he couldn't match it anymore.

"OMG," Sherrie exclaimed. "Look at me, I'm so hot." Sherrie couldn't believe what she was seeing. She was not only wearing trendy clothes, but she recognized why the look worked. She also knew that all her clothes at home had been transformed. This was great. She was sure that both the girls and the boys would notice. Alex was no longer her friend, but she didn't mind. She would make new friends.

"Thanks," Evan said. Now that he was her friend, he knew which classes Alex would be in. He determined to see her as soon as possible and find a way to invite himself to his former home.

152232123121211211112.content:
Evan took Sherrie's friendship with Alex away. She no longer had any feelings for her, she is just another person to her now. Sherrie is of course delighted with her new expensive, mature wardrobe. She feels like a little girl who was allowed to play dressup and she wanted to get home to try everything on. But unlike a little girl, she could show off her new wardrobe to everybody. She was giddy with excitement. Time would tell if she would give up her new wardrobe for her best friend back.

Evan knew every class that Alex was in. She was his best friend now and he knew everything about her. He knew many things that he hadn't known when he was her brother. Regardless, he knew exactly where she would be at the end of the day. he determined to meet with her then and walk her home.

When the school bell signified the end of the day, Evan ran out of his classroom to pick up Alex on her way home. Alex was glad to see him. "Hey Evan, what's up?" she said cheerfully.

"I've had a day like you wouldn't believe, but I don't want to talk about it."

"Awe come on do tell."

"No, it's fine now. I had a problem, but I think I have finally worked it out. It's not done yet, but the end is in sight."

"What's it all about."

"I don't want to jinx it, I promise I'll tell when it's all over."

"Do you have a new girlfriend?"

"No it's nothing like that." Evan did get laid a couple days before with Christine, but did that mean they were bf/gf? He didn't know. Certainly he couldn't tell Alex about him and Christine.

"Then what is it?"

"Later, but I hear you have been making eyes at Seth." This knowledge entered Evan's brain when he became BFFs with Alex. He knew Alex's secrets. But he didn't know if Alex knew his.

"Seth and I are just friends."

"Just friends?" Evan didn't really care, but he had to steer the conversation away from what is going on with him.

"Yes just friends."

"Have you kissed him?"

"NO!"

"Have you thought about kissing him?"

Alex hesitated for a moment. "You do think about kissing him."

"Yes is that a crime?" The conversation continued until they got to Alex's house. Evan invited himself in. They went to Alex's room and started to listen to music.

"I have to go to the bathroom, I'll be right back." Evan said. He had to see if Christine was at home. But she wasn't. Evan needed to ask Alex where Christine was. Christine was no longer grounded.. Since he was now Alex's BFF there was no reason for Miranda to object that Christine was with him.

"Howe are your sisters?"

"Annoying as usual."

"They aren't around? Where are they?"

"I think they are out with their boyfriends."

Christine has a boyfriend??? I didn't know that?"

"Yeah she is dating Mark. They have been friends forever. But I don't, know recently things just changed. I think she really likes him now."

"OMG" is what Evan thought, but what he said was "I'm glad, they make a great couple."

They listened to music and made small talk. During the conversation, Alex said she envied Evan. She wanted to throw a killer party but she couldn't because she lived at home. She wished she lived alone like Evan did.

A while later after dinner, Miranda told Evan he had to go home in about a half hour. It was getting late. Evan waited for Christine but she still wasn't home. Evan could imagine Christine doing to Mark what she had done to him. Evan didn't know whether to be happy for Mark or jealous.

With little time before he had to leave Evan decided to tell Alex about his power. "I know you are not going to believe me, but I can swap traits with anyone I like."

"Yeah right." No one ever believed him when he told them.

"No it's true and I was thinking, if you want to throw a killer party you can do it at my house. I'll just swap our houses and you'll live alone there and I'll live here with your family."

"Won't anyone notice?"

"No, everyone will think it's always been that way."

"I don't believe you."

I have done it before?"

"Yeah like what."

"Well that is how I got my paper route." Evan decided he could tell this one thing.

"No you've had that for a year."

"That isn't true. I've only been doing it for two days now."

"I remember when you first got the job."

"See that is how it is, everyone remembers the way it was after the swap."

"You are putting me on."

"Look would you like to live at my house instead of here?"

"Sure."

"OK, I'll swap it then."

"I don't feel any different." But looking around the room was changed. It wasn't Alex's room, it had Evan's things in it now. This included Sherrie's crappy wardrobe. But besides the clothes, Alex's room now looked like a room for a boy. "Holy shit! What just happened?"


"We swapped, you now live across the street."

Miranda soon thereafter came into the room, She told Alex it was time to leave and made her go. This suited Evan fine. Now he could wait for Christine no matter how long it took.

1522321231212112111121.content:
With Alex gone, Evan settled in for the wait for Christine to return home from her date with Mark. It was still a bit much to wrap his head around. It was also hard to keep track of everything that had been swapped. He knew he needed to be more careful going forward.

Evan didn't have to wait too much longer, because he soon heard Christine arriving home. He quickly ran to greet her, eager to swap back with her. "Christine, you're finally home!" he practically shouted upon seeing her.

"Evan, what are you doing here?" Christine asked, surprised to see him. "And ... what are you wearing?" she added, noting the outfit of Sherrie's that he was now wearing. For whatever reason she seemed to notice the swaps he had made that didn't involve her. Evan wasn't really thinking about that at the moment though; he just wanted to get back to normal.

"It's ... a long story," Evan replied.

***

"You what?!" Christine shouted after learning of the swaps Evan had made to be able to see her again in order to get back to normal. "You had no right to swap my ..." She paused a moment to think of the right word. "Stuff like that!"

"Well, I didn't have much of a choice," Evan countered. "And you're not so innocent either," he added, thinking of what Christine had told him about her night out with Mark. "Mark is my best friend, who knows what consequences you sleeping with him will have caused once we get back to normal."

"Well, he's my boyfriend in this new reality, so I had every right."

"Just like the traits I swapped away were mine in this reality. It was worth it if it means getting back to normal."

Christine folded her arms. "Hmm. I guess you have a point there ... but how do you suggest we get both of us back to normal?"

"Well we can start by getting me back to normal and then--"

"Uh uh," Christine interrupted Evan. "I'm not swapping back until you get my traits back."

"But that will just make us run into the same issue we had before. My mom will keep us from meeting up again." Evan was feeling exasperated, but he wasn't going to give up yet. "How about this?" he asked. "What if we at least trade back the traits that I didn't swap away? By that I mean our ages and families. My mom won't ground me like she grounded you."

"We could do that I suppose," Christine agreed.

"Alright." Evan nodded then closed his eyes, focusing on swapping ages and families back with Christine. He soon felt his body shifting back to his 17 year old self. Opening his eyes, Evan saw that Christine was back to being 28 again.

"Being younger again was fun, but I definitely like being my own age again," Christine said. "Now to getting my other traits back. I wanna be able to dress sexy again."

"And I would like to have male clothing again," Evan said, still feeling awkward in Sherrie's clothes. "But I think it will be easier to get your house and job back."

1543321232.content:
"we should swap our lives and various skills!" she exclaimed

"why?" evan asked with some concern

"well think about it you are a seventeen year old going to 5th grade and living in my house who also now hangs out with eleven year olds, we don't know if people will see that is weird but if we swap lives people will think you are 11 and that it is normal, and then we swap the necessary skills we need to fit in with each others lives" she explained

"but i don't want to swap that stuff" evan complained

"yeah well i want to see what your life is like and i already have your family and i won't swap back until i have at least a day or two to see what it is like, you do need permission remember" she pointed out "it will only be for a day or two"

feeling a bit reassured he reluctantly agreed to her terms and hey it might be fun...

"ok lets do it one at a time" he said "what do you want first?"

"well lets start with life as that is why we will need to swap skills"

evan commenced the swap and when he was finished he looked down to see the hot pink skater dress that Allison was once wearing except it was resized to fit him he was also wearing the sandals she was wearing also resized

"what the heck why did we swap clothes?" evan asked in shock

"i mean you have my life and i am quite girly so i guess that means as part of the package of my life you get my clothes and i get yours?" she said looking down to the shirt and jeans she was now wearing "ok here is a pen and piece of paper write down all the skills i will need to live your life effectively and i will do the same" Allison stated handing him a piece of paper and a pen

Evan made his list and when Allison made hers they started reading them out

"ok first of all you will need my ballet skills and knowledge because i have a super important ballet recital tomorrow morning" she stated

"wait what?" he said in shock "i have to do ballet?!?!?" getting a bit nervous

"it is fine, if you have my skills you should be fine" she reassured

"ok then... but how would that work i know nothing of ballet and i don't think you can swap nothing for nothing" he reasoned

"simple have you played any sports before?" she asked

"yeah i played a bit of soccer back when i was forced to do a sport"

"then we'll swap that, my skills and knowledge of ballet for your skills and knowledge of soccer" she exclaimed

Evan swapped the skills and then instantly a wave of knowledge about ballet flooded his mind he then stretched and did a pirouette "oh my god i can do a pirouette... i actually know what a pirouette is!, and i am so flexible now!" he exclaimed

"must be part of the swap" she reasoned

"ok next you will need to know how to animate" evan laughed

"why?" Allison asked

"because have to finish my animation assessment for IPT by next week" evan explained

"ok then i guess for that you will gain my very minimal knowledge of makeup!" she giggled

" i guess that makes sense..." he replied

and he then swapped it around

15433212322.content:
"What you really need is my rules and rights," Allison said.

"What do you mean."

"I mean, like I have to be able to do the things you do to be you."

"I am giving you my skills. That should be enough."

"Well like I'm eleven and I can't cross the street to walk to school by myself. How will I go to your school if I can't cross the street. There are a whole bunch of things I still can't do. Plus how will you go to ballet if you can't change in the dressing room with all the other girls?" There was a boys changing room, but Allison didn't mention that.

"Oh OK, so as long as I am you I have your rules."

"WOW GREAT!!!" Allison screamed in an excited fashion. She was much more excited than she should be.

"Hey what gives?"

"Well I haven't been totally honest. Evan began to worry.

"About what?"

"Well I wasn't home really because the air conditioning went. I was suspended for three days."

"You were what?"

"Suspended. See there was this boy in class I liked and something happened in class and we were caught."

"What happened?"

"Do you want to know?"

"Yes," and instantly everything that happened was in Evan's head. She was in love with this boy, Odell. She snuck out of class and met up with him. They were kissing (and doing a little more, not too much they were only eleven) in the staircase when they were caught. Evan now knew all about it, he even had Allison's feelings for the boy now. He was totally crushing on him. He also knew about the suspension that resulted and that he was now grounded for a month. Allison was not allowed to leave the house although her mother left to go to the store for a few minutes. If she caught him outside when she returns home, it would get worse.

"In a month we will swap back when I'm no longer grounded. Up until then, have fun," Allison said and she ran off.

15433232.content:
"You want to swap Mark's attitude towards you?" Evan asked, a bit confused.

"Yeah. I'd like to try a while where I'm not just treated like his dumb and annoying little sister. I still want to be his sister just you know, get some respect?" Allison explained.

Evan shrugged, thinking, "What's the worst that could happen?"

Concentrating, Evan thought he'd done the swap, but there was no way to be sure.

"So?" asked Allison.

"I think I did it..." said Evan, "But how do we check?"

Allison smiled. "Phone him," she said.

Evan took out his phone and called Mark. It rang for a while and finally Mark answered with, "Evan. What do you want. Why the heck are you phoning me?"

Allison asked to talk to Mark.

"Allison wants to talk to you," Evan said, a bit upset at Mark's reaction.

"Oh. Cool, put her." Mark suddenly seemed happier.

Evan handed Allison the phone and she put it on speaker mode. "Hey Mark!" she said.

"Oh hey Allison. Why'd you get my annoying friend Evan to phone me? Is your phone dead or something?" Mark responded.

"Nah, he just wanted to. You know how he is..." Allison said.

"Oh hell yeah! He's just so annoying. More like a little sister than anything. I'm sure glad I've got a sister like you who I'm best friends with. It'd suck if you were like Evan. You know he's always going on and on to our parents about this or that thing he wants..." Mark's complaints seemed to prove the swap worked.

"Yeah. Anyways, I'd better hang up now. Don't want Evan to be complaining about you wasting his minutes..." Allison said smiling.

"Oh, yeah. Sure this Allie. See you soon!" Mark answered just before Allison hung up.

Evan was upset. He knew he was still technically friends with Mark, but didn't like being treated that way by him and worried how long the friendship would last like that.

Figuring that the car was his either way, he tried to unlock it with his keys. They fit, so Evan hopped inside.

The inside of the car was similar to a small two-seater, with a few exceptions that Evan immediately noticed. For one thing, there wasn't a steering wheel. In its place were several large, blocky buttons with symbols on them depicting windshield wipers, turn signals, and climate controls. Evan recognized most of these symbols, but each also had words describing what the button did (for example, the button depicting two arrows next to a windshield wiper read "Whipers: Very Fast"). Evan's curiosity got the better of him, and he started pressing the buttons in random order. However, none of them did anything. He then noticed the big red button labeled "On," and figured that he should push that one first.

After pushing the button, a slot on the dash opened up and a touchscreen appeared seemingly from nowhere. The screen blinked to life, and a sentence appeared written in a large, easy to read font, which Evan appreciated. At the same time, the sentence was read by a monotone GPS-sounding voice. The sentence was:

"Hello Evan. Where do you want to go?" A list of three locations appeared: Home, Amy's House, and School. A small "+" rested beneath them.

Evan immediately understood what the car was. "A robot!" he exclaimed. Giggling, Evan selected the "Home" option, and car started to drive. It pulled away from the parking space, and soon enough Evan was on the road.

"So I gave the girl my smarts but got a really cool car? This power's awesome!" Evan exclaimed, as he watched the car change lanes. Drawing his attention back to the buttons, Evan tried to turn on the windshield wipers. Instead, the voice reappeared, saying, "It's not rainy today. We don't need the wipers." "Oh, okay," Evan said. He tried a few of the other buttons, and was met with similar responses. After his attempts, the car started asking questions. "What's two times four?," "When did the dinosaurs go extinct?," "How many sides does a cube have?," etc. To Evan, these were very challenging and engaging questions, and they distracted him from the buttons.

This continued until Evan arrived home. The car prompted Evan to hit its "Off" button, which he obliged to. The touchpad disappeared back into the dash, and Evan stepped out and walked into his home. His mom greeted him with a smile and a hug, and asked how his trip to the mall was.

"It was fine, but the ride home was better. The car asked a bunch of questions, and it was really fun! The car's so cool!" Evan said excitedly.

"I'm glad you liked it! I told the car to ask you some questions because you have a test tomorrow." Evan's expression became shocked. He had forgotten about switching schools with the girl, and he thought he had to take a high school level test with his intelligence. This made him very nervous.

Seeing his shock, his mother said, "You didn't forget, did you?" Evan just mumbled, with a few "Uh"s thrown in. His mom put on a patient smile and said "Oh, it's okay sweetie. Third grade is hard, but you'll do fine, okay?" "Okay," Evan said, immensely relieved that he wasn't in high school. "Now why don't you get some homework done while I make you a snack?" his mom offered while gesturing to a backpack next to the kitchen table. "Sure! That sounds great!" Evan dug through the backpack, looking for his new homework. Evan's mom smiled, proud of her son and his willingness to learn.

Evan thought it was funny that his mom didn't notice anything different. It was like he had a secret that no one knew, which was exciting. However, he still wanted to try out his power, after seeing what it could do. With this in mind, Evan...

1543323222131311113.content:
"Let me give you an example." Said Li, striding over to the sofa in the living room, fetching the TV remote, and flicking to a program Evan recognized as a popular reality show. He recognized the celebrity fashionista, not because the show itself was particularly interesting, but because the surgically enhanced woman and her Hollywood acolytes continually showed up in the news for doing something outrageous. Popular for being popular.

"I understand what these people are saying but the meaning is totally flying over my head." She explained to Evan. "See how that one refers to her friend? I know what the word bitch means of course, but why would someone use that word in such an endearing manner?"

She glanced over at Evan, seeing him visibly struggling to keep up with the pace of the conversation on TV. It was like she could see the gears whirring in his head, manually sifting through the fast-paced English and converting each word piecemeal into their Chinese equivalents. She felt kind of sorry for Evan. In a way, Li surmised, he must have had the same problems growing up as she had, language-wise. "Evan?"

He tore his attention away from the program and chuckled. "I so sorry... they talking very fast!"

"But you understand why they act like that, right?" Probed Li. "Your knowledge of American culture." She flicked to a sports channel showing highlights from an American football game. Evan recognized the teams, gameplay, strategies, and he recalled the live games he attended with his friends and the brief period in his childhood playing linebacker in a Pop Warner league. The names on the backs of players' jerseys may have looked Romanized and foreign, sure, but the cultural significance of the game was obvious to him.

"Again, I have a perfect comprehension of what these colour commentators are saying," Said Li, "But precisely what they're talking about is confusing to me. I'm afraid I won't get a true experience of your country's culture living as an outsider."

A pause. Evan took a few moments to fumble over the words he wanted to say to Amy's foreign exchange guest. "This game is called football... It is very fun."

Li huffed. "Yes. I know. But what is it like to watch the game fully immersed in the culture? To get all the references, the nuance behind it all?"

Evan's facial expression betrayed that deer-in-the-headlights look Li knew all too well. It was the same look of perplexity that her schoolmates back in China had when they couldn't adequately parse her English. Oh, how frustrating!

Finally, he replied. "Ahh... I no understand what you say.... 'nuance' shì shénme yìsi tā mā de... Can you say again?"

"Never mind. I just wish I had better understanding of your culture, so it would be easier to truly get what people are talking about!"

Evan's eyes lit up. "Wénhuà. Yī yán wéi dìng!" He snapped his fingers and declared quietly to himself. "We change culture!" Stumbling over the pronunciation of 'culture' with his thick Chinese accent. He closed his eyes again. When he opened them up, Li was sitting next to him on the sofa eyeing him oddly like before. Only this time... her clothing changed!

Whereas before, Li had been wearing a floral-print pinafore dress over a plain white blouse, now she was dressed in a pink tank top and acid washed jeans. Her hair, formerly styled in a conservative bun tied by a ribbon, now descended past her shoulders with the help of extensions expertly clipped on and made to look completely natural. Her roots hinted a shade of blonde from when she had dyed her hair several months ago. While her ears were pierced both before and after the swap, now in a particularly rebellious phase she had gotten her tongue pierced as well, with hoops replacing the modest studs in her ears. Her skin also showed slightly more colour than before, thanks to a newly found preoccupation with tanning. Aside from ethnicity, she looked like a beautiful, thoroughly western teenage girl.

Evan, on the other hand, appeared different but in a less radical way. Gone was the screen-printed logo of the local college on his t-shirt, replaced by a Chinese brand written in Mandarin text. Rather than plaid khaki shorts, Evan now wore a pair of gray drawstring sweatpants and flip flops, a kind of effortless combination he didn't need to think twice about. Evan's dark brown hair now sported a healthy dosing of gel to maintain that spiky, just-got-out-of-bed look. While still ethnically White, he now looked, talked, and behaved like someone half a world away... and same for Li.

Not that Li was any the wiser about the swap. Evan decided again to keep everyone but him unaware of the change... figuring that he could simply get her consent to swap back again when the time comes.

"Anyway, like I was saying..." Li continued, oblivious to the changes. "Ever since I started this foreign exchange program I've felt so much more comfortable living in this country. Everything just seems to make more sense than when I was in China, y'know?"

Evan looked at the TV screen again. There were a bunch of uniformed players running around on a grassy field and trying to get whoever was holding an egg-shaped brown ball.

"Take this football game for example." Said Li, explaining how the game is played to her host's boyfriend. "We don't have anything like this where I come from. But I usually stay up late at night to watch live events. Concerts, dance performances, comedy shows, you name it!"

Evan nodded and tried to grasp the fun things his classmates would always talk about. Finding their discussions to be too unfamiliar to make much sense of them. Recalling, instead, the new year festival he enjoyed in February over at the cultural center in the local Chinatown area of his city. Also being able to rattle off the names of the well-known soap operas, news anchors, and dramas on CCTV, the state-owned television powerhouse.

What an amazing power! Evan wanted to keep trying it out... but should he continue with Li? For the first time it looked like she was genuinely enjoying herself, sitting there and flipping between channels, all the while jabbering away in English that Evan could only marginally comprehend.

What happens next?

Douglas got onto the bus with the other students at his stop. He climbed the steps and looked for a seat. He knew the names of everyone in the bus. They were all kids from his part of town. All the passengers were dressed in the school uniform like he was. The boys of all ages were wearing the same uniform, pants and polos or button down shirt in the school colors. The girls in the younger grades (such as Douglas' first grade) wore jumpers. The girls in the fourth and fifth grade wore blouses and skirts. He looked for a place to sit. He found a seat by a girl in 'his grade' that he knew. Douglas's feet were firmly on the ground when he sat. This wasn't true for most of the students especially those in the lower grades.

Douglas couldn't believe he was here. He was so happy he almost skipped to his seat, although it was too cramped to do so in the bus. But he smiled from ear to ear. He took off his backpack to make it easier to sit. Inside he carried all of his books and supplies. All the the written work, formerly done by Marissa had been rewritten in Douglas's handwriting.

"Dougie what are you so happy about?" Stephanie (the girl he sat next to) asked.

"Oh nothing. I'm just looking forward to school." At this grade most kids liked school, it wasn't until the later grades that kids became more cynical. But at this grade, it most mostly fun and all the child's friends were there. Douglas remembered his role playing games, but all knowledge of sex was removed from his mid with the swap. Thus he was happy to be here, but didn't know why anymore and certainly didn't have any sexual thoughts on this matter nor any other matter. He didn't even know the true difference between boys and girls anymore. Douglas and Stephanie occupied their time talking about this and that. Soon the bus had arrived at the school.

Douglas and the rest of the students disembarked the bus and entered the fenced in area that was the school grounds. Douglas looked for his friends. None of his friends were boys or even girls who were in a higher grade than first grade. He put down his knapsack and joined in the game. Before he knew it a loud whistle was sounded and he lined up with his class at the appropriate area. A school monitor (a fifth grader) made sure all the kids were properly in line until the teacher took over and led the students to the class room. On the way, the teacher stopped by the rest room to allow any student who needed it to relieve themselves. Everyone knew not to dawdle, although none of the students had heard that word used before. He was in the first grade class now.

Once brought to the room, he knew which was his seat. The seat he was to sit in had been changed from Marissa's seat which looked like all the others, to one that could accommodate his adult frame. Not that any of the students nor the teacher thought it was odd. Looking around the brightly decorated room, Douglas noticed the work of the students hanging in various areas of the room, especially taped to the windows. he even recognized his own work and smiled.

Douglas was caught daydreaming as he looked around the room. He couldn't believe he was really here. Everyone treated him like a little school girl and he loved it.

"Douglas...Dougggglas....DOUGLAS" the teacher said trying to get his attention.

Snapped out of his daze, Douglas responded, "Yes Mrs.Ansler."

"Douglas, what do we do when we take our seats?"

"We do the 'Do Now', Mrs. Ansler."

"Are you doing the 'Do Now?"

"No Mrs. Ansler."

"Well..."

Douglas got to work. He opened his knapsack and took out his black and white composition book and his folder which contained his homework. Everyone else had already placed their homework on the top left hand side of their desk to be checked by the teacher. He did the same. Then he opened his book and looked for the next page to start his work. He glanced at the preceding pages and saw his work there. It was clearly his work, it had his name on the top with the date in his handwriting. He found the next blank page and in the left margin wrote the date. He wrote it in the 'proper fashion: three letters that represented the month, then the day followed by a comma and the four digits of the year. In the right margin he printed his Name Douglas Anderson. Then in the first blank line he wrote 'Do Now' in the center. Followed by the problem:

"Jill had 9 pencils, she gave away 4 pencils. How many did she have left?"

...and then he worked out the answer.

The first thing he considered is this addition or subtraction? He wasn't sure at first. But take away seemed like subtraction so he tried that. He wrote the numbers one below the other and then added a subtraction sign to the left and a straight line underneath. Then he tried to remember, what is 9 minus 4. He thought it was five but he wasn't a hundred percent sure. He used his fingers to confirm it, by holding up nine fingers and then bending four, leaving five left. Satisfied he wrote down the answer. Then he moved onto the next problem, following the same procedure (including checking with his fingers).

Meanwhile the teacher walked around the room, checking the homework as she saw it and encouraging the students who needed help. He worked at his own pace and answered the questions as best he could. He didn't want to raise his hand to answer anything since he wasn't sure he had the answers right and he didn't want to embarrass himself on his first day of school. Technically everyone thought he had always been a student, but he knew different. The teacher did call upon him in the middle of the class for an answer and with her encouragement he came up with the right answer and was rewarded with a "Very Good," by the teacher.

During recess he also didn't say too much. He just wanted to fit in but not stand out. That was until one of the boys snuck up behind him and pulled the click-on bow out of Douglas' hair. It hurt a but as the tugging pulled his hair with the bow. The boy ran off. Without thinking, Douglas got out of his seat and ran after the boy. With his long adult legs he caught him easily and then lifted him into the air yelling at him. It only took a moment before the cafeteria attendant arrived on the scene.

But her stubbornness gave way eventually, and she sat down on the end of the bench and pouted.

"Hum!" She puffed. "This swapping business isn't as useful as I hoped it would be."

"Well, brother dear, I was only half teasing when I denied there was anything in it for me." His sister admitted ruefully. "We talked about this before the school day ended, me and Kelly and Amanda. They said if the swap actually worked, they would each give me their week's allowance. And as we walked over here to find you, I thought to myself, I could make a lot of money doing this."

"Doing what? Pimping me out because I agreed to help you swap others around?" Evan retorted. Deciding not to highlight Alex's insistence that any and all monetary rewards would accrue only to her, not to, you know, the person who actually possessed the power and was doing all the work!

The next day (Tuesday) at school...

To her knowledge, nobody but Abigail Adams herself knew about the surplus supplies closet in the old music room. The way the room was designed was unique in that the closet was originally caulked and sealed away from use. When the school was built all those years ago, the basement was initially a locker room for the sports team, but they eventually got their own separate building next to the gym. That room, which became the music room, was remade and the showers converted into a surplus room for old and worn out supplies. And while the doorway appeared to blend in perfectly with the wall next to the lectern, she knew how to depress the side opposite the hinges just enough to sneak in and out. Old Mrs. Hughes, before she retired after Abigail's freshman year, taught at the school's inception and, as a result, knew about the room and showed it to her the day she retired. All this is to say it was Abigail's secret garden, her Narnia where she could briefly escape from a world that neither understood nor cared much for people like her.

People like her. Abigail embraced darkness and solipsism for as long as she could remember. Now a senior in high school, she was already looking past graduation with uncertain plans for whatever comes next. She enjoyed the company of H.P. Lovecraft, Agatha Christie, or Emily Dickinson to interactions with the Abercrombie & Fitch brigade upstairs. She was also very religious, which most people got wrong about her and confused her with the dumb Satanists at school like Blaine Johnson and his ilk. The crucifix necklace dangling on her swan-like, pale neck should have been an indicator. She wished more people understood the literary, artistic, and cultural origins of Gothic Europe and America, but her admittedly stereotypical way of dressing didn't help much. Besides the crucifix necklace, today Abigail wore a satin, black frock with lace trim around the hem, fitted under a gray bodice. Her black stockings clashed with a pair of combat boots that added a flair of punk but felt much more comfortable for walking than flats or pumps. Her hair was straight and black as the night sky. She hadn't worn makeup all week as if to prove a point to no-one in particular.

At lunch, Abigail was laying prone in the beanbag chair she smuggled into the surplus supplies closet a few weeks ago re-reading her favourite book of Sylvia Plath poems. She was nodding asleep at the time she heard muffled voices on the other side of the door.

At first alarmed, and then intrigued, Abigail pressed her ear close to hear the peculiar conversation between Evan and Alex. She soon recognised the pair as two of her neighbours from across the street! They moved in a few years ago but hardly talked with (or even saw) each other. But she could tell by their tone Evan was having none of what Alex was selling. She could also tell they were keeping a big secret. Something to do with swapping.

"Awwww, you're like the least fun sister ever! You've got such a terrific power and you're afraid to use it!" Abigail heard her say.

"We've been over this before. Just because I can swap anything with someone if we agree to it doesn't mean I should. Now... get out of my way!" Abigail heard him reply forcefully. Then she heard the door slam and their footsteps die out on the stairway, the rest of their conversation fading into the walls.

A swapping power? Abigail pondered silently. Perhaps that kid may be worth talking to after all.

She looked askance, before clutching her arm demurely. "I know I said that earlier, Evan. But..."

He sighed at this thought, as he took a sip of chamomile tea and placed the cup back onto the tray. info.brief_description: Evan has the power to swap anything with another person, but there's a catch. GPs given!
info.description:
After having a weird dream, Evan is granted the power to swap anything between himself and another person. However, there's a catch: he can only swap with a willing individual. Evan can swap anything from body parts, personality traits, clothing, relationships, occupations, etc., but only equivalent parts can be swapped (that means hands can be swapped with hands and feet with feet, but no swapping hands with feet). Reality will adjust to match the changes, such as clothes resizing to fit a changed body. By default, the power makes it so that those involved in the swap are aware of changes while those not involved in the swap aren't, but it does allow Evan to control who is aware of swaps, making more people aware of them, or making any of the people involved in the swap unaware of it. The power only works on humans, not on other animals.

Aside for the restrictions mentioned above, there's some leeway in terms of how you want to have the power work. Maybe using the power drains a lot of energy if used a bunch at once, or maybe some swaps start to have some side effects over time, or maybe it's possible to control awareness of swaps that have already occurred, or maybe it's possible for Evan to swap the power to someone else. The one thing I ask is that you keep it consistent within a story branch.

This story stands on its own, but it is also the seventh part in a series of loosely related interactive stories that share the same universe.

Gift Points will be given out to good chapters. The amount of points will depend on how good/long your chapters are. Happy writing.

Rules
Please use good spelling an grammar. This is my biggest pet peeve. If you make a few mistakes I will fix them but if your chapter is grossly illegible, I will delete it because I'm not going to waste my time fixing it.

Please keep the story in 3rd person (that means he, his, her, etc. not I, me, or you) past tense (ran not run). I have nothing against 1st and 2nd person and present tense, but I like keeping the story consistent throughout.

Please try not to spam one sentence chapters, especially past the first few chapters of the story. It's annoying and doesn't really advance the story. I will delete chapters like this if it gets out of hand.

Keep with the continuity of the story branch. For example, if the power has some secondary property as mentioned above, keep it consistent in the branch.

Please try not to abruptly end the story. If you want to end it, go ahead, but please build up to it first. For example, it wouldn't be enjoyable if in chapter 3 it just reads "They swapped back and then Evan never used the power again. The end."

Sex is fine, but be realistic; most people don't have sex 30 times a day.

Character death is a thing that can happen, but please try to keep it to a minimum since its not really the focus of the story.

Most importantly... Have fun and don't be afraid to add! This story isn't going to write itself you know...

Characters
Evan Wilson: The main character. He's a pretty average 17 year old boy. He has short brown hair and an average build, standing at 5'10".

Stephanie Wilson: Evan's 19 year old sister. She's home from college for the summer. She has straight light brown hair with blond highlights that ends right above her shoulders. She has a pretty average height at 5'5" and a nice frame with D-cup breasts.

Alexandra Wilson: Evan's 15 year old sister. She goes by Alex and is a total tomboy. Her brown hair is short for a girl, just passing her ears and reaching her neck. She has C-cup breasts. Her wardrobe consists of a mix of somewhat more masculine clothing and some more feminine stuff, but she doesn't like to wear skirts or dresses unless absolutely necessary. She stands at 5'2" but probably isn't done growing just yet.

Miranda Wilson: Evan's 42 year old mother. She has shoulder length dark brown hair and C-cup breasts and is 5'4". She's a fourth grade teacher at the local elementary school.

Jack Wilson: Evan's 43 year old father. He has an average build but he's kind of tall, standing 6'0", and he has short light brown hair with a slight hint of gray. He works at a marketing company.

Amy McKay: Evan's 17 year old girlfriend. She's the nicest person ever and fun to hang out with. She's quite attractive, with long blonde hair, C-cup breasts, a slender frame, and a height of 5'4". She's kind of a girly girl but she is willing to play video games with Evan.

Melanie McKay: Amy's 14 year old sister. Goes by Mel usually. She's a pretty typical scene girl and tends to dye her hair a variety of different colors. She can be annoying at times but she is generally pretty cool. She has B-cup breasts and a height of 5'0".

Mark Herbert: Evan's 17 year old best friend. He has dark hair that comes down just past his ears and he's tall, standing at 6'1". He has a hyperactive personality and tends to get himself and Evan in all kinds of crazy situations.

Allison Herbert: Mark's 11 year old sister. She's a total girly girl and has long dark hair. She is only just starting to develop breasts and hasn't reach her full height, standing only 4'8" tall. She is kind of weird.

Scott Lin: Evan's 16 year old close friend. Mark's neighbor. He hangs out with Evan and Mark a lot. He's of Chinese descent and is 5'6" tall. He has kind of short hair that he gels up in the front. He's rather easygoing.

Tina Lin: Scott's 18 year old sister. She's popular at school and a generally nice person. She and Scott don't always see eye to eye but tend to get along well enough. She has long hair and C-cup breasts and stands at a height of 5'1".

Jennifer Austin: Evan's 16 year old close friend. Goes by Jen. She lives across the street from Evan. She's kind of shy and quiet but she is a reliable friend. She has dark shoulder length hair and wears glasses and she has B-cup breasts and is 5'3". She's an only child.

Christine Wallace: Evan's 28 year old next-door neighbor. She's a hot blond with D-cup breasts, a perfect figure, and a height of 5'6". All the neighborhood boys drool at the very thought of her.

Denise Gerard: Evan's 40 year old next-door neighbor on the other side. She's a single mother with straight light brown hair about halfway down her neck and C-cup breasts. She's 5'4"

Anna Gerard: Denise's 13 year old daughter. She's kind of nerdy but also kind of punky at the same time. She can be kind of socially awkward at times in a cute sort of way. She wears glasses, has shoulder length blond hair that is dyed a mix of pink and black at the ends, and she has A-cup breasts and a height of 5'0".

Abigail Price: 18 year old girl that lives across the street from Evan. She's a grade above Evan and is known at school as the creepy goth girl. Her parents are pretty much never around. She has long dark hair that partially covers her face and she wears heavy gothic style makeup and goth clothes like corsets and combat boots. She had C-cup breasts and is a bit tall for a girl at 5'9". She randomly talks to Evan when they bump into each other at school or on the street about the weirdest things.
